cmCourseInfo.description: This preparatory course helps students navigate the challenges ahead in the world of Co-op and business. This course is highly interactive and practical, and is completed before students start seeking their Co-op work term opportunity. Management experienced Coordinators and expert guests instruct students on how to succeed in their work terms. This course is a compulsory requirement for all Management Co-op programs. Students must pass this course before proceeding to seek for a work term opportunity, therefore, this course may be repeated.
cmCourseInfo.title: Advancing Your Career Exploration
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Restricted to students in the Management Co-op programs.
cmCourseInfo.note:
1. If you are enrolled in this course, you would not be required to complete: [COPB11H3 and COPB12H3] or [COPB13H3 and COPB14H3].
2. UTSC internal applicants are accepted into the Management Co-op in early May.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
The Co-op Management Work Term Preparation course is mandatory for all Management Co-op students prior to their first work term. It is a credit requirement in addition to your BBA degree requirements and is not included in your cGPA. There are no tuition fees attached to the AYCE course.

MGT Co-op students will be automatically enrolled into the co-op prep course in the Summer semester.
For any questions regarding this class, please contact the Management Co-op office at 416.287.7111 or mgmtcoop.utsc@utoronto.ca

courses.name: Foundations for Success in Art and Science Co-op

cmCourseInfo.description: This course provides students in their first-year of Arts and Science Co-op to develop skills and tools to manage and thrive during the job search and in the workplace throughout the semester. In addition, students begin to build their job search tool kit, examine their strengths and areas of development, discover the skills employers are seeking in undergraduate Co-op students and in employees in general, and explore possible pathways to achieving their Co-op work terms and long term academic or career goals. Students will learn and practice strategies to best present their skills, knowledge and experience in foundational job search documents. The concept of interviewing is also introduced. This course is a compulsory requirement for the Arts and Science Co-op programs. Students need to pass the course before proceeding to seek for a Co-op work term, therefore, this course may be repeated.
cmCourseInfo.title: Foundations for Success in Arts and Science Co-op
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.
cmCourseInfo.note: Students should plan to complete this course in the first year of study in their selected Arts and Science Co-op program.

courses.name: Foundations for Success in Art and Science Co-op

cmCourseInfo.description: This course provides students in their first-year of Arts and Science Co-op to develop skills and tools to manage and thrive during the job search and in the workplace throughout the semester. In addition, students begin to build their job search tool kit, examine their strengths and areas of development, discover the skills employers are seeking in undergraduate Co-op students and in employees in general, and explore possible pathways to achieving their Co-op work terms and long term academic or career goals. Students will learn and practice strategies to best present their skills, knowledge and experience in foundational job search documents. The concept of interviewing is also introduced. This course is a compulsory requirement for the Arts and Science Co-op programs. Students need to pass the course before proceeding to seek for a Co-op work term, therefore, this course may be repeated.
cmCourseInfo.title: Foundations for Success in Arts and Science Co-op
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.
cmCourseInfo.note: Students should plan to complete this course in the first year of study in their selected Arts and Science Co-op program.

courses.name: Preparing to Compete for your Work Term

cmCourseInfo.description: This course builds on the foundational job search concepts introduced in COPB50H3, providing opportunities to refine application strategies and practice interviewing in various formats, based on academic program areas as well as industry hiring practices. Students begin to experience the Co-op job search cycle by reviewing, selecting, and applying to job postings weekly and receiving feedback similar to when participating in a job search cycle. With this feedback, and the support of your Coordinator, students make adjustments to their job search approach and develop strategies for success in the following term for both job applications and interview performance. The importance of a job search network and research to tailor and prepare during your job search are also examined. This course is a compulsory requirement for the Arts and Science Co-op programs. Students need to pass the course before proceeding to seek for a Co-op work term, therefore, this course may be repeated.
cmCourseInfo.title: Preparing to Compete for your Work Term
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: COPB50H3/(COPD01H3); restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
LEC01 - Physical and Environmental Sciences Co-op, Physical and Environmental Sciences Co-op [Health Sciences Stream] Life Sciences Co-op, Life Science Co-op [Health Sciences Stream], Psychological and Health Studies Co-op and Psychological and Health Studies Co-op [Health Sciences Stream]

Bachelor of Science students can enroll into PRA0001 or PRA0002.

LEC02 - Computer Science Co-op, Mathematics Co-op, Statistics Co-op, Computer & Mathematical Sciences students can enroll into PRA0003 or PRA0004.

LEC 3 - Humanities and Social Sciences Co-op
Students can enroll into PRA0005 or PRA0006.

Practicals start on the week of May 5th and run every other week

Students requests to enroll in the course will be reviewed at 3 points prior to the start of the semester and approval is based on successful completion of COPB50.

1st review: mid April
2nd review: end of April
3rd review: early May (before waitlist end date and last date to add course)

courses.name: Managing Your Job Search and Transition to the Workplace

cmCourseInfo.description: This course will draw on students' job search experience. Students will learn how to effectively and professionally navigate challenging situations while job searching and on work term. Drawing upon the job search knowledge and tool kit created in COPB50H2 and COPB51H3, this course is designed to provide students who are competing for a first Co‐op work term with resources and support necessary to meet their goal of securing a work term. During this semester, Co-op students are applying to job postings on CSM and attending interviews until they secure a work term. This course also provides students with job search trends, job search support and feedback, interview coaching, and peer activities. The course is a combination of in‐class, group activities, and one‐on‐one appointments. Topical information and insights about the labour market and Co‐op employers are also provided.
cmCourseInfo.title: Managing your Job Search and Transition to the Workplace
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: COPB51H3/(COPD03H3); restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Students will be enrolled in this course by the Arts & Science Co-op Department.

LEC01 - Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Neuroscience, Health Studies, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Conservation & Biodiversity, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology


LEC02 - Computer Science, Math and Statistics Co-op students

LEC03 - Humanities and Social Science co-op programs: English, French, History, Philosophy, Linguistics, Psycholinguistics, Women's studies, City Studies, Public Policy, Health Policy

PRA0001 is for students in Physical and Environmental Science, Life Science, and Psychological and Health Sciences Co-op, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Medicinal and Biological Chemistry, Neuroscience, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology, Environmental Sciences, Conservation and Biodiversity, Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Health Studies - Population Health

PRA0002 is for Psychological and Health Sciences, Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Health Studies Population Health, Neuroscience, Psycholinguistics, Linguistics, Psycholinguistics, English, History, French, Philosophy, Women's Studies, City Studies, Public Policy, Health Policy

PRA0003 is for Computer Science Co-op, Mathematical Science Co-op and Statistics Co-op

PRA0004 is for Computer Science Co-op, Mathematical Science Co-op and Statistics Co-op

PRA0005 is for students in Humanities and Social Science Co-op, Linguistics, English, History, French, Philosophy, Women's Studies, City Studies, Public Policy and Health Studies - Policy

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is for students in Arts & Science Co-op who have undertaken a first work term search and successfully completed COPB52H3 but have not embarked on a first work term experience. Students in this course will continue with job search activities and receive additional support factoring in their overall learning.
cmCourseInfo.title: Continuing your Co-op Job Search
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: COPB52H3/(COPD11H3); restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Students will be enrolled in this course by the Arts & Science Co-op Department.

LEC01: Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Neuroscience, Health Studies, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Conservation & Biodiversity, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology
LEC02: Computer Science, Math, Statistics
LEC03: Humanities and Social Science co-op programs (French, English, History, Philosophy, Women and Gender Studies, Linguistics, City Studies, Public Policy and Health Studies - Policy)

courses.name: Integrating Your Work Term Experience Part I

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is designed to provide students who have completed their first work term with tools and strategies to effectively integrate their recent work term experience into their job search documents, as well as practice articulating their new or enhanced skills and experience in an interview setting. Students are provided with opportunities to practice and refine their approach as they begin to seek their next Co-op work term. In class Apply Together sessions and one-on-one appointment consultations with your Work Term Engagement Coordinator will provide you with semester specific market trends, tools and resources to succeed in your job search. There are also online and in person forums for sharing work term and job search experience with junior Co-op students and peers.
cmCourseInfo.title: Integrating Your Work Term Experience Part I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: COPB52H3/(COPD11H3) and completion of one work term; restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op Programs.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Students will be enrolled in this course by the Arts & Science Co-op Department.

LEC01: Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Neuroscience, Health Studies, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Conservation & Biodiversity, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology
LEC02: Computer Science, Math and Statistics Co-op students
LEC03: Humanities and Social Science co-op programs (French, English, History, Philosophy, Women and Gender Studies, Linguistics, City Studies, Public Policy and Health Studies - Policy)

courses.name: Integrating Your Work Term Experience II

cmCourseInfo.description: This course is designed to provide students who have completed 2 work terms or more with tools and strategies to effectively integrate their recent work term experiences into their job search documents as well as practice articulating their new or enhanced skills and experience in an interview setting. Students are provided with opportunities to practice and refine their approach as they job search/compete for another Co-op work term. In class Apply Together sessions and one-on-one appointment consultations with your Work Term Engagement Coordinator will provide you with semester specific market trends, tools and resources to succeed in your job search. Having the experience of job searching and at least 8 months of work term experience, students share, compare, and contrast their individual experiences. There are also online and in person forums for sharing their work term and job search experience with junior Co-op students.
cmCourseInfo.title: Integrating Your Work Term Experience Part II
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: COPC98H3/(COPD12H3) and completion of at least two work terms; restricted to students in the Arts and Science Co-op programs.
cmCourseInfo.note: Students complete this course each time they are job searching for a work term beyond their second work term.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Students will be enrolled in this course by the Arts & Science Co-op Department.

LEC01: Psychology, Mental Health Studies, Neuroscience, Health Studies, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Conservation & Biodiversity, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology
LEC02: Computer Science, Math and Statistics co-op students
LEC03: Humanities and Social Science co-op programs (French, English, History, Philosophy, Women and Gender Studies, Linguistics, City Studies, Public Policy and Health Studies - Policy)
